decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to be aggressive and put pressure on the opponent. It utilizes a combination of blue, white, and red cards to quickly disrupt the opponent's strategy and deal damage. The deck includes a mix of spells and creatures to control the board and maintain card advantage. Key cards include Sphinx's Revelation for card draw and life gain, Restoration Angel for additional tempo and protection, and Snapcaster Mage for spell recursion. The deck also includes board wipes like Supreme Verdict to clear the opponent's creatures and maintain board advantage.

The deck focuses on using a combination of removal spells and powerful creatures to control the board and outvalue the opponent. It includes a variety of versatile threats like Huntmaster of the Fells and Olivia Voldaren, along with disruption spells like Rakdos's Return and Bonfire of the Damned. The mana base supports a range of powerful multicolored spells, enabling the deck to consistently apply pressure and answer threats. The deck's strategy revolves around efficiently trading resources and maintaining board control until it can overwhelm the opponent with its powerful threats.

The main concept of this deck is to use a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By playing threats like Thragtusk, Huntmaster of the Fells, and Lifebane Zombie, along with removal spells like Tragic Slip and Dreadbore, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot while generating advantage through card advantage and life gain. The deck also utilizes ramp spells like Farseek to quickly cast its higher cost spells like Rakdos's Return and Bonfire of the Damned to further solidify its control over the game.

The main focus of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to control the board and the opponent's creatures while maintaining card advantage through cards like Restoration Angel, Augur of Bolas, and Sphinx's Revelation. The deck also has a mix of burn spells like Warleader's Helix, Searing Spear, and Pillar of Flame to deal direct damage to the opponent. With counterspells like Dissipate and Syncopate, along with removal spells like Turn / Burn and Supreme Verdict, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and win the game through efficient creature removal and card advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly build a powerful board presence using low-cost creatures, focusing on white cards. These creatures benefit from each other's presence, with cards like Champion of the Parish and Silverblade Paladin boosting their power. The deck also includes protection cards like Brave the Elements and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben to keep the creatures safe. The deck also utilizes a few removal options like Banisher Priest and Searing Spear to control the opponent's board. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and resilient army of creatures.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient spells. By utilizing a mix of burn spells, counter spells, and card draw, the deck aims to control the board and maintain a steady stream of threats. With a solid mana base and versatile options like Sphinx's Revelation and Supreme Verdict, the deck can adapt to different matchups while always looking to end the game quickly. Overall, the strategy revolves around tempo and constantly applying pressure to overwhelm the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures. It focuses on playing low-cost creatures like Strangleroot Geist, Flinthoof Boar, and Ghor-Clan Rampager to quickly establish a strong board presence. Domri Rade helps provide card advantage and creature support, while Mizzium Mortars provides removal options. Stomping Ground and Rootbound Crag ensure consistent mana sources, while Kessig Wolf Run offers additional creature buffing. Thundermaw Hellkite and Hellrider act as powerful finishers, dealing damage to the opponent and their creatures. Overall, it aims to apply constant pressure and dominate the battlefield.

This deck aims to win quickly by playing aggressive creatures and burning the opponent's life total while maintaining control of the board with counter spells and removal. The deck also includes card draw and life gain spells to outvalue opponents in longer games. The creatures included provide value upon entering the battlefield or provide additional card advantage. The deck has a good mix of creatures, removal, counter spells, and burn spells to handle a variety of threats while maintaining pressure on the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and versatile spells to maintain control of the battlefield while dealing damage to the opponent. By efficiently controlling the board with cards like Supreme Verdict and Detention Sphere, while also having access to powerful creatures like Aurelia, the Warleader and Thundermaw Hellkite, this deck aims to apply pressure and close out games quickly. Additionally, cards like Sphinx's Revelation provide card advantage and life gain to help sustain through longer games when needed. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the spells and creatures in the deck.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game and outvalue the opponent by using powerful removal spells, card advantage engines, and efficient threats. The mana base is designed to consistently cast powerful spells at all stages of the game. Creatures like Thragtusk and Huntmaster of the Fells provide value when they enter the battlefield, while cards like Olivia Voldaren and Lifebane Zombie disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also has a strong late-game finisher in Rakdos's Return to close out games.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to adopt a control playstyle while also putting pressure on the opponent by efficiently removing threats and dealing damage. The deck focuses on card advantage through draw spells like Sphinx's Revelation and Think Twice, while also having powerful removal options like Warleader's Helix and Supreme Verdict. By utilizing a combination of control spells and powerful creatures like Restoration Angel and Aetherling, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and secure victories through a combination of attrition and aggression.

The main concept of this Jeskai Aggro deck is to use a combination of efficient creatures like Augur of Bolas and Restoration Angel, along with versatile spells like Azorius Charm and Warleader's Helix, to put pressure on the opponent and control the board. The deck also includes card advantage and tempo plays with cards like Think Twice and Snapcaster Mage, while having some counter and removal options with cards like Dissipate and Pillar of Flame. The deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive tempo while also having answers to opponent's threats.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures in the Selesnya colors. The deck aims to quickly establish a board presence by playing efficient creatures like Avacyn's Pilgrim, Voice of Resurgence, and Loxodon Smiter. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Thundermaw Hellkite and Boros Reckoner to deal significant damage and control the board. To support the creature strategy, the deck includes Domri Rade for card advantage and removal spells like Bonfire of the Damned and Mizzium Mortars to clear the way for the creatures.

This deck focuses on using powerful creature threats like Huntmaster of the Fells, Thragtusk, Olivia Voldaren, and Lifebane Zombie to control the board and maintain dominance. It also includes a mix of removal spells like Dreadbore, Putrefy, and Tragic Slip to eliminate opposing threats. The deck also features ramp spells like Farseek to reach its higher mana costs quickly, and powerful finishers like Bonfire of the Damned and Rakdos's Return to close out games. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes utility lands like Kessig Wolf Run.

The main focus of this Jund Control deck is to maintain control of the game by utilizing removal spells like Dreadbore, Putrefy, and Tragic Slip to deal with threats while also disrupting the opponent's hand with Duress and Lifebane Zombie. The deck aims to generate card advantage through cards like Underworld Connections and Garruk, Primal Hunter while also creating pressure with powerful creatures such as Olivia Voldaren and Thragtusk. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency in casting the spells needed to control the game and close it out with finishers like Dragonskull Summit and Kessig Wolf Run.

This deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells, utilizing cards like Searing Spear, Warleader's Helix, and Pillar of Flame to deal damage directly to the opponent or remove their creatures. It also includes counterspells like Syncopate and Dissipate to protect its threats, as well as card draw and deck manipulation with cards like Jace, Architect of Thought and Desolate Lighthouse. The deck's finishers include powerful threats like Aetherling and Restoration Angel, ensuring a strong late-game presence.
